title: RStatistics

metadata.description: Learn about RStatistics with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Statistics Introduction
Statistics is the science of analyzing, reviewing and conclude data.
Some basic statistical numbers include:
Mean, median and mode
Minimum and maximum value
Percentiles
Variance and Standard Devation
Covariance and Correlation
Probability distributions
The R language was developed by two statisticians. It has many built-in functionalities, in addition to
libraries for the exact purpose of statistical analysis.
You will learn about these features, and how to use them in the 
Tip:
If you are completely new to statistics, and want to learn more about it, visit our
Statistics Tutorial
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers RStatistics concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use RStatistics effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of RStatistics and how to apply it in your projects.
